summary: This document contains profiles and biographical information about Jeffrey E. Epstein, detailing his career, philanthropic efforts, and financial background. It highlights his connections to various organizations and individuals, including his notable client Leslie Wexner. The document provides insights into Epstein's wealth and professional history.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is presented as a prominent financier and philanthropist with a significant net worth, known for his connections to various educational and financial institutions.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as one of Epstein's biggest clients, known for his role as the founder of the Limited chain of women's clothing stores.

connections.description: Leslie Wexner is noted as a significant client of Jeffrey E. Epstein's financial firm.

keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein has an estimated net worth of $2 billion.
He was born on January 20, 1953, in Brooklyn, New York.
Epstein began his career at Bear Stearns and later founded his own financial firm, J. Epstein & Co.
Leslie Wexner is identified as one of Epstein's most notable clients.
Epstein has been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including funding programs at Harvard University.
